intro: Lapathum digynum, commonly known as narrow-leaved betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are arranged in whorled clusters, producing small, violet-blue blossoms that attract pollinators. Lapathum digynum is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
